slides.title: What is an Object?
slides.content:
# Objects ðŸ—ƒï¸

Javascript objects are containers for named values called properties.

```javascript
const car = {
  type: "Fiat",
  model: "500",
  color: "white"
};
```

Access properties:
- `car.type` (Dot notation)
- `car["type"]` (Bracket notation)

# Arrays ðŸ“‹

An array is a special variable, which can hold more than one value.

```javascript
const cars = ["Saab", "Volvo", "BMW"];
```

Access Elements:
- `cars[0]` // Saab

Change Elements:
- `cars[0] = "Opel";`

slides.title: Array Methods: Basic
slides.content:
# Basic Array Methods ðŸ› ï¸

- `push()`: Adds a new element to end.
- `pop()`: Removes the last element.
- `shift()`: Removes the first element.
- `unshift()`: Adds new element to beginning.
- `length`: Returns the number of elements.

```javascript
let fruits = ["Banana", "Orange"];
fruits.push("Apple"); // ["Banana", "Orange", "Apple"]
```

slides.content:
# Destructuring Arrays ðŸ¥¡

Unpack values from arrays.

```javascript
const fruits = ["Banana", "Orange", "Apple", "Mango"];

const [first, second] = fruits;
console.log(first); // Banana
```

Skipping items:
`const [first, , third] = fruits;`
